isis.stitle: AIR CONDITIONING - HEATER SYSTEM: 5000, 9000 Series Without Lowered heater Box - REMOVE AND INSTALL - HEATER CORE, HEATER WATER VALVE AND BLEND-AIR DOOR ASSEMBLY

svcproc.title: HEATER CORE, HEATER WATER VALVE AND BLEND-AIR DOOR ASSEMBLY

svcprocinfo.para: The three components covered here are closely related and are serviced as an assembly ( Figure 15). While each unit can be removed from the Blend-Air box individually, much time can be saved by removing them as one assembly.

note.para: A putty-type sealant is used where components pass through the cab floor. Carefully remove this sealant when removing the components. Reseal the components after installation.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury from hot coolant, do not remove the heater hoses from the heater core inlet and outlet until the cooling system has cooled down.

step1.para: Turn off engine coolant supply to the heater with the heater hose gate valves in the engine compartment, or clamp off the heater inlet and outlet hoses ( Figure 14) with C-clamps and wood blocks. Be sure not to damage the hoses.

Note how the heater hoses are connected to the heater core ( Figure 14), and label the hoses for proper reconnection later. Disconnect the heater hoses from the inlet and outlet fittings under the cab.
Remove the two elbow fittings and sealant (or insulating tape) from the heater core tubes.

note.para: Plug the heater hose inlet and outlet tubes to prevent coolant from being released inside the cab during removal of the heater core.

step1.para: Remove the screws securing the passenger seat and the Blend-Air housing cover plate. Remove the seat and cover plate from the cab.

figure.caption: Figure 15. Heater Core and Blend-Air Door Exploded View

step1.para: Release the clip on the control cable and detach the cable from the blend door ( Figure 15).
Locate and remove two mounting screws which secure the outboard side of the heater core to the housing.
Locate and remove two mounting screws which secure the blend door frame to the housing.
Lift the heater core, heater water valve and blend door from the housing as an assembly.
Loosen the clamps on the hose that connects the heater water valve to the heater core ( Figure 15).
Remove the two screws securing the blend door frame to the heater core to separate the heater core from the door frame ( Figure 15).
Remove the clip from the water valve operating lever to detach the adjustable link that connects the valve to the blend door ( Figure 15).
Remove the four mounting screws and detach the heater water valve from the blend door frame.
Service, replace or adjust individual components as required.
Align the heater water valve to the blend door frame and secure with four mounting screws ( Figure 15).
Connect the valve operating lever to the blend door with the adjustable link and secure with the clip.
Connect the heater core to the water valve with the short length of heater hose. Leave the hose clamps loose ( Figure 15).
Align the heater core to the blend door frame and secure it with two mounting screws.
Tighten the hose clamps.
Insert the assembly into the blend-air unit housing, noting that the coolant inlet and outlet tubes pass through the bottom of the housing and the cab floor.
Secure the assembly to the housing with four mounting screws, two screws into the side of the heater core and two screws into the blend door frame.
Connect the control cable to the blend door and install clip.
Check the operation of the blend door and the heater water valve. Adjust the link as required (see HEATER WATER VALVE ADJUSTMENT).

At the underside of the cab, install the elbow fittings to the heater core inlet and outlet tubes and connect the heater hoses. Secure with hose clamps. Make certain that the supply hose is on the inlet tube and the return hose on the outlet tube. The heater core inlet tube is the one nearest the center of the cab.
Wrap the fittings with insulating tape (or use sealant) to seal the floor openings ( Figure 14).
Open the heater water valves at the engine; or remove clamps used to close hoses, if used.
Replace coolant lost during heater core removal. Refer to the Operator's Manual for the correct type of coolant.
Set the heater (HTR) control lever to HOT. Operate the engine. Check for coolant leaks and check for proper operation of blend door and heater water valve at both HOT and OFF positions.
Install the Blend-Air unit cover and passenger seat assembly. Tighten the six thumb screws.
